sub_title: Senior Researcher at Wageningen University & Research, The Netherlands - Phytopathology, Fusarium, Banana, Biocontrol, Molecular diagnostics, Laboratory and Greenhouse Screening facilities
summary:
I am a highly motivated scientist with a broad orientation and over 30 years of experience. My major interests are plant-pathogen interactions and intracellular signalling in plants and plant pathogens. To study these complex mechanisms, I like to integrate data, obtained from Bioinformatic, Molecular Biological, Proteomics, Biochemical approaches and Common sense. 
    My main drive is to contribute to plant research and development for environmental sustainable production of food. To achieve this I like to set-up new approaches, using my creative spirit, and by participation in multidisciplinary projects. 
    Currently, my focus is mainly on banana and the pathogens threatening this important crop such as Fusarium wilt of banana. The work involves genomics, biochemistry, disinfectant analysis, laboratory & greenhouse trials and screening experiments at the WUR facilities. Next to this I offer advice for field work.
For more information, look at: http://fusariumwilt.org/
https://scholar.google.com/citations?hl=en&user=GRf1Kn4AAAAJ&view_op=list_works&sortby=pubdate

profile_positions.description:
Bananas are a staple food for more than 400 million people in the tropics. They are the fourth most consumed food crop, the most consumed non-cereal staple food, and the most consumed fruit in the world. Global banana production is, however, threatened by widespread fungal diseases: Panama disease and Black Sigatoka. 

In this work I start and maintain collaborations with other Research groups within and outside our University and companies.  I am guiding PhD's, MSc's and guests in our group on research and for publications. Next to fundamental and applied research,  I take my share in lab and office management.

For further information on our research watch the attached documentary or:
http://www.fusariumwilt.org/index.php/en/about-fusarium-wilt/
youtube.com/user/bananaresearch
profile_positions.title: Research Associate

profile_positions.location: Laboratory of Phytopathology, Plant Sciences Group, Wageningen, The Netherlands
profile_positions.description:
Research Fellow (Post-doc) at the Laboratory of Phytopathology at Wageningen UR
(Chairholder Prof. Dr. ir. B. Thomma, in the Phytophthora group headed by Prof. Dr. F. Govers).
Project:
-Development of strategies to combat the potato late blight pathogen Phytophthora infestans and related organisms (oomycetes). 
-Focus is on the identification of novel, and essential genes and proteins, by Molecular, Genomic, Proteomic and Biochemical approaches. The identified genes and proteins will be exploited for the discovery and development of novel anti-oomycete agents.
profile_positions.title: Research Fellow (Post-doc)

profile_positions.location: University of Amsterdam, Swammerdam Institute of Life Sciences,  The Netherlands
profile_positions.description:
Post-Doc in the Plant Physiology group, at the University of Amsterdam
(Chairholder Prof. Dr. M.A. Haring, Supervision by Dr. T. Munnik)
Projects: 
1) Visualization of phospholipid signalling and the identification of novel phospholipids by using an extensive set of TLC techniques. 
2) Mining the Arabidopsis thaliana genome for phospholipid signalling enzyme encoding genes and screening of T-DNA insertion lines.
3) Cloning and functional characterization of phospholipid signalling enzymes by gene silencing in tomato
Techniques: Biochemistry, Lipidology, Molecular Genetics and Biology, Genetics
profile_positions.title: Post-doc

profile_positions.location: University of Amsterdam, Swammerdam Institute of Life Sciences,  The Netherlands
profile_positions.description:
PhD student in the Plant Physiology group at the University of Amsterdam.
(Chairholder Prof. Dr. H. van den Ende, Supervisors Dr. A. Musgrave/Dr. T. Munnik)
Project: Identification of new phospholipids in plants and elucidating the role of phospholipid signaling in response to osmotic stress.
Techniques: Biochemistry, Lipidology
profile_positions.title: PhD Researcher
